articles.title: Powerball jackpot soars to $1.7 billion for Saturday drawing after no one won Wednesday's $1.4 billion grand prize
articles.description: The Powerball jackpot has climbed to an estimated $1.7 billion after no winning tickets were sold for Wednesday's drawing. This makes it the third-largest lottery prize in U.S. history. The cash option for Saturday's drawing is an estimated $770.3 million.

articles.title: Florida to end vaccine mandates for children as state’s surgeon general likens them to ‘slavery’
articles.description: Florida's Surgeon General, Joseph Ladapo, announced plans to eliminate all mandatory childhood vaccinations for school entry, a move that would make Florida the first state to do so. Ladapo controversially compared vaccine mandates to "slavery" during the announcement.

articles.title: NBA says it will investigate report Clippers broke salary cap rules with Kawhi Leonard deal
articles.description: The NBA has launched an investigation into the Los Angeles Clippers regarding a $28 million endorsement deal between Kawhi Leonard and a company with financial ties to team owner Steve Ballmer. The probe will examine if the deal was used to circumvent the league's salary cap rules.
